Package ca.cyberscientist.toystoredb.model

Class Figure

java.lang.Object
ca.cyberscientist.toystoredb.model.Toy
ca.cyberscientist.toystoredb.model.Figure
public class Figure extends Toy
A class which models figures, such as action figures, dolls, or historical figures.
Author:
Bryce Carson

  • Field Details

    • classification

      String classification
      The classification of this figurine. It can be "action," as in action figure, a doll, or a "historical" figure.

  • Constructor Details

    • Figure

      public Figure(String serialNumber, String name, String brand, double price, int availableCount, int appropriateAge, String classification)
      Parameters:
      serialNumber - The serial number to associate with the figure.
      name - The name to associate with the figure.
      brand - The brand name (manufacturer) to associate with the figure.
      price - The cost of the figure in dollars and cents.
      availableCount - The number of this figure in inventory.
      appropriateAge - The minimum recommended age for this figure.
      classification - The sort of figurine this is.

    • Figure

      public Figure(String[] fields)
      Create a figurine from a string array. Wraps the more complex constructor.
      Parameters:
      fields - The record from the on-disk "database" to create a figure from.

  • Method Details

    • getClassification

      public String getClassification()
      Acquire the classification of the figurine, such as action figure, doll, or historical figure.
      Returns:
      the classification of the figure.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Description copied from class: Toy
      The toString method of all toys, providing a drier way to format each object for saving to disk. Ends with a semicolon so each toy type can merely append the next item.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Toy
      Returns:
      String the pretty-printable form of the object.

    • format

      public String format()
      Description copied from class: Toy
      Ensure that each subclass implements a format method to call the super.toString() method and append the subclass-specific information for saving to disk.
      Specified by:
      format in class Toy
      Returns:
      The formatted string which will be used when saving the object to disk.
